intro: Astragalus alopecians, commonly known as the woolly milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its root system is deep and robust, allowing it to access water from deeper underground. Astragalus alopecians plays an important ecological role by providing food for various insects and wildlife.
